titlestmt.titleproper: Albert J. Schmidt Collection of Lantern Slides, c.1904-1921
titlestmt.author: Benson Latin American Collection

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Christian Kelleher, CA, April 2006

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Albert J. Schmidt Collection of Latern Slides

extref.corpname: Benson Latin American Collection, The University of Texas at Austin

did.abstract: 593 latern slides of scenes from Mexico and reproductions of cultural materials photographed by C.B. Waite, W.H. Horne, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: 593 lantern slides, circa 1904-1921. Subjects include: Art reproductions of Mexican codices, Aztec cultural artifacts, and images of the conquest of Mexico; views of monuments, sites, and scenes in Mexico City, the Distrito Federal, Mexico state, and other Mexican cities and states. Many reproductions are of items in the National Museum of Mexico. Most other slides are commercial travel views of street scenes, people, buildings, and social life and customs in Mexico, including bullfights, plantations, and other representative Mexican scenes. Photographed by C. B. Waite (Mexico City), W. H. Horne (El Paso, Texas), and unidentified photographers.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Standard copyright restrictions apply. Use of the lantern slides may also be restricted due to their fragility.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: Albert J. Schmidt Collection of Latern Slides, Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, the University of Texas at Austin.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The Albert J. Schmidt Collection is classified under the following Subject Headings:

controlaccess.subject: Aztecs--Antiquities--Photographs
Indians of Mexico--Social life and customs--Photographs

scopecontent.p: A list of the Albert J. Schmidt latern slides is available in the Benson Latin American Collection rare books and manuscripts reading room.
